bibl.title: Letter from Robert U. Patterson to John J. Moran, June 13, 1934

div1.p: Patterson thanks Moran for the donation of his yellow fever certificate to the Army Medical Library.

div1.head: Letter from Robert U. Patterson to John J. Moran, June 13, 1934
div1.opener:
IN REPLY REFER TO S. G. O. _________________________
WAR DEPARTMENT
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL
WASHINGTON
June 13, 1934.
Mr. John J. Moran,
Compania Sunoco de Cuba, S. A.,
Avenida Menocal No. 102-A,
Habana, Cuba.
My dear Mr. Moran:
div1.p:
General Kean has delivered to me your yellow fever
certificate, and this has been placed for safe keeping in the Army
Medical Library among the other valuable books and papers forming
the collection of that Institution.

It is extremely good of you to make this presenta-
tion of a document which must necessarily be of no little personal
value to you as well as great historical significance. It will be
kept in the library together with some of the original memoranda
of Major Walter Read and the others who, with you, made history dur-
ing those trying times.

In order that you may not be without a copy of this
precious document, I am sending you herewith a photostat.

If I might make another request, it would be that
you write me a letter stating that you are presenting this yellow
fever certificate to the Surgeon General of the Army for preserva-
tion in the Army Medical Library. Such a letter from you, when
filed with the original document, would add to its value and show
for all time the way that it came into our possession.

With best wishes and the high regards of the Medi-
cal Department of the Army as a whole, I am,
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, Rob't. U. Patterson,
Major General, U.S. Army,
The Surgeon General. Incl.
ALL COMMUNICATIONS SHOULD BE ADDRESSED TO “THE SURGEON GENERAL, U. S. ARMY, WASHINGTON, D. C.”
